head.supplied: Melbourne bot Garden, ¶ 8. June 1858. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your communication, ¶ in which you express a desire of the honorable the Chief Secretary, that I should...

div.p: E58/5093, unit 745, VPRS 1189 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your communication,
J. Moore to M, 7 June 1858 (in this edition as 58-06-07a). in which you express a desire of the honorable the Chief Secretary, that I should attend at an interview between his Honor & the officers of the Zoological Society on the 10th instant
In reply I beg to state, that I shall feel very proud to respond to his Honors invitation.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

div.p:
Mr Undersecretary J. Moore &c &c &c
See also J. Moore to M 15 June 1858 (in this edition as 58-06-15a) and M to J. Moore, 15 June 1858 (in this edition as 58-06-15b).
